item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenAI is shockingly good at unminifying code (39 points | 5 comments)
2. Air Con: $1697 for an on/off switch (1150 points | 288 comments)
3. Show HN: Homemade Automated Solar Concentrator (36 points | 3 comments)
4. Two Dots Too Many – a tragic consequence of the failure to localize cell phones (19 points | 8 comments)
5. Show HN: turn videos into ASCII art (open source, js+canvas) (13 points | 4 comments)
6. Computer Scientists Prove That Heat Destroys Entanglement (56 points | 13 comments)
7. UK rail minister got engineer sacked for raising safety concerns (131 points | 73 comments)
8. Docusaurus – Build optimized websites quickly, focus on your content (64 points | 22 comments)
9. I spent an evening on a fictitious web (8 points | discuss)
10. What Life Means to Einstein (1929) [pdf] (58 points | 29 comments)
11. Deterministic Replay of QEMU Emulation (80 points | 17 comments)
12. Type 2 diabetes drug associated with 35% lower risk of dementia, study finds (28 points | 8 comments)
13. Maker Skill Trees (375 points | 84 comments)
14. Windmill (YC S22) Hiring Rust and TypeScript Eng #3 in Paris ( | hide)
15. Window Maker: X11 window manager with the look and feel of the NeXTSTEP UI (235 points | 116 comments)
16. Superhuman Built an Engine to Find Product Market Fit (2018) (4 points | discuss)
17. Google's new pipe syntax in SQL (277 points | 139 comments)
18. Show HN: Firebuilder: A complete Firefox customization tool (94 points | 8 comments)
19. Show HN: LLM-Term – Simple Rust-based CLI assist tool (8 points | 3 comments)
20. The first snapshot of Hacker News on Archive.org (7 points | discuss)
21. The Future of TLA+ [pdf] (174 points | 73 comments)
22. An incredibly simple, open-source alternative to Loom that only requires S3 (15 points | 6 comments)
23. Monumental architecture in Atlantic Europe: fifth-millennium BC enclosure (42 points | 2 comments)
24. Scaling Rails and Postgres to millions of users at Microsoft (165 points | 47 comments)
25. HDMI Forum rejects AMD's HDMI 2.1 open-source driver (216 points | 106 comments)
26. Panasonic Toughbook 40 (173 points | 160 comments)
27. Show HN: A directory to find open source AI projects easier (14 points | 5 comments)
28. If you love something set it free – AKWF Waveforms now in public domain (2015) (14 points | 3 comments)
29. A dishwasher can make or break a restaurant (2017) (255 points | 443 comments)
30. Show HN: Skip – Build native iOS and Android apps from a single Swift codebase (237 points | 79 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 11:15 AM UTC
